Message.Title: Analysts lowering S&P expectations so low....that it will be easy to beat....but is that good if EPS are lower for stocks???
Message.Msg: "The headwinds are enormous, even if you have good earnings, and I don't think we're going to," he says, "so it's hard to see how you have a really rosy earnings season." And he's not alone. In a note client this morning, Knight Capital's Peter Kenny writes that the upcoming profit parade will beat lowered expectations but will hardly be "a barn burner." And FactSet earnings analyst John Butters pegs growth expectations for the S&P 500 this quarter at 0.7% now, down from 4.2% at the start of the quarter. Also set to hinder further gains, Dempsey says, is the fact that all-important guidance is likely to be very subdued in the face rising interest rates, fuel prices and uncertainty. "The market is wringing out inflation expectations everywhere," he says, "so if there are no inflationary expectations, than earnings by definition should be lower."

Message.Msg: Mr. Justice Sheinberg: I believe your message about zevoter and dfaduke needs to be posted again. The punishments you describe appear to be appropriate for these miscreant traitors who place partisanship ahead of loyalty to their country. "Ms. Joyakid, in my country we do not have capital punishment. Instead we allow miscreants to undergo forms of punishment that do not harm them physically but subject them to some discomfiture. For example, we may permit a prisoner to spend time in a sealed room which has been densely populated with very feculent odors. Many refer to it as a Mexican Gas Chamber. I leave it to your gentle imagination what it must smell like once donkeys, chickens and swine have been allowed to stay there a long while and no refuse removed. Well, in the cases of zevoter and dfaduke, they might be invited to spend, say, every other night in such an aromatic, nostril-filling space for one or two months. And, possibly, in their cases a few farm animals would share their space. Under our judicial system zevoter and dfaduke would have the right to choose the proportion they wish among 1) donkeys fed a diet of pinto beans and marinated boiled cabbage, 2) chickens fed a diet of spicy chachalupa, and 3) swine fed a diet of chile con carne liberally dosed with fermented tabasco sauce. Topic.Title: come, follow me I will make you fishers of compliements ROFLMFO.

Message.Msg: Uh, do you have any pull with the Circus Circus goon squad and/or local constabulary? I set the Beech down cleanly enough (well, except for clipping a couple of satellite dishes and a beach umbrella, but hey, my deliberate ground-loop just short of the back entrance was brilliant, and narrowly averted what could have been an unscheduled vintage aviation display in the lobby.) Anyway, I told them I had no intention of staying in their dump and was in fact simply paying you a social call (I thought it might be counterproductive to mention the Bundy-Dube Economic Summit until I had a better idea of where their economic sympathies lie). Fortunately I remembered that I'd stashed a load of vintage virgin meerschaums in the Beech's golf club compartment - I didn't need all of them to cover the vig on Alonzo's restoration of the Staggerwing) and told them my real business in town was over at the Sands, where the IAPCPR convention kicks off on Saturday (that's the International Association of Premium Cigar and Pipe Retailers trade show). They checked out my story, found the pipes, and things were going fairly well until I said I'd just take off again and fly over to the show. They said after such a #$%$ landing I wasn't going to be flying anywhere for a while; I pointed out that I absolutely stuck the landing compared to the one Cirque de Soleil dropped on their audience last month, and things went downhill from there. Do you think Larry would be willing to post MY bail? Of even more immediate and pressing concern, though, ROTFLMAO, do you know if the Corrections Department offers Ibogaine and sushi on their Room Service menu?

Message.Msg: Just when you think you have heard all of the stupid things that are going on in the US -- this comes along... Black hurricanes.... Well, it appears our African-American friends have found yet something else to be #$%$ about. A black congresswoman (this would be Sheila Jackson Lee, of Houston), reportedly complained that the names of hurricanes are all Caucasian sounding names.. She would prefer some names that reflect African-American culture such as Chamiqua, Tanisha, Woeisha, Shaquille, and Jamal. I am NOT making this up! She would also like the weather reports to be broadcast in 'language' that street people can understand because one of the problems that happened in New Orleans was, that black people couldn't understand the seriousness of the situation, due to the racially biased language of the weather report. I guess if the weather person says that the winds are going to blow at 140 MPH, that's too hard to understand I can hear it now: A weatherman in New Orleans says... Wazzup, mutha-fukkas! Hehr-i-cane Chamiqua be headin' fo' yo #$%$ like Leroy on a rocket! #$%$ be a category fo'! So, turn off dem chitlins, grab yo' chirren, leave yo crib, and head fo' de nearest FEMA office fo yo FREE shiet.
